intro: Discladium obtusatum, commonly known as the broad-leaved sea holly, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its robust, succulent stems and broad, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a waxy coating. The plant produces small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months. It is typically found in coastal areas and saline environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Discladium obtusatum plays a role in stabilizing dune ecosystems and providing habitat for various small organisms.
